name: Back Pain
description: Back pain is discomfort or stiffness in the upper, middle, or lower back. It is commonly caused by muscle strain, poor posture, prolonged sitting, or minor injury.

mild.definition: Mild back pain with short duration and no danger signs

moderate.definition: Persistent back pain affecting daily activities

high_risk.definition: Severe back pain or back pain with neurological symptoms

criteria.other_symptoms: numbness, weakness in legs, loss of bladder control

self_care: Apply warm compress to the affected area
Maintain proper posture while sitting and standing
Avoid heavy lifting or sudden twisting movements
Ensure adequate rest but avoid prolonged bed rest

medicines.name: Paracetamol 500mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Relief of mild to moderate back pain
medicines.dose: Adults: 500–1000 mg every 6 hours (Maximum 4000 mg in 24 hours)

medicines.name: Ibuprofen 400mg Tablet
medicines.dose: Adults: 400 mg every 6–8 hours with food (Maximum 1200 mg in 24 hours OTC)

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if back pain is severe, persistent, or associated with numbness, weakness, or loss of bladder control.

assessment_questions.question: How severe is your back pain?
How many days have you had this pain?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek urgent care for severe or worsening back pain.
